intro: Acis autumnalis var. oporantha, commonly known as the autumn acis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a slightly hairy texture, and the flowers are usually pale pink or white. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
